content.question: The Congressional Leadership Fund, a PAC, has raised over $50 million dollars, which it plans to spend on advertising in the next midterm election. It plans to target its spending in competitive districts in the days leading up to Election Day. Which of the following court cases decision is most likely to protect the right of the group in the scenario?

choices.label: New York Times Company v. United States (1971)
Citizens United v. Federal Election Commission (2010)

content.answer: Citizens United v. Federal Election Commission (2010)

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Explain how a required Supreme Court case relates to a relevant political principle, institution, process, policy, or behavior.
